data.title: Tasty and varied vegetarian food- you won't miss the meat
data.text: I've been to this place many times over the years.  The thalis, dosas, and many other dishes you don't find commonly are available.  I wish the breads-papads on the thali were crisper.  The flavors of the dishes are complex- you know they make it from scratch.  It is a great place to enjoy vegetarian food, or authentic Indian food.

data.title: You won't miss the meat
data.text:
I love Indian cuisine, but never tried a vegetarian only restaurant. Frankly, I was sceptical before going to this place but have to say it is a culinary experience worth trying.
The ambiance is ok, the service is good although I have to admit I sometimes have problems understanding the staff due to strong accent. The food is super tasty. We had some dosas with spicy potato filling, really good. I ordered a so-called Thali and my wife had a Curry which was super flavorful. The Thali is very interesting as it includes six small cups, each with a different dish or sauce and it comes with rice. Some of the flavors were very unique. maybe one or two of the cups you will not like, but it is a great way to taste different things.

BTW, I find their lunch box is good as well and reasonably priced.

data.title: Nice authentic Indian food - Vegetarian and vegans.
data.text: The food was very good. it is all vegetarian and many vegan options. They have selection from different regions in India that is not that common to find. Service was good and the price was fair. Worth visiting.

data.title: Best Vegetarian Indian Outside Manhattan
data.text:
Great variety of vegetarian dishes. They make a soft dosa versus very crisp like the Delhi style but the potato filling is excellent as is the Sambar.

Their Potato Bunda is world class.

They serve a very competent Bhel Poori amd Mirchi Pakoda.

Tables outdoors are very pleasant in the early fall.

data.title: Poor management and hygiene
data.text:
We had lunch at Navaratna on Saturday 14th August 2016. I was taken aback as I headed for their 'restroom'. On the way there were things lying around in the narrow passageway. I also had a glimpse of their kitchen and the preparation room. Oh boy! What a sight!! I wondered, wasn't there an authority to check on such restaurants. Such unsightly kitchen, I have never seen in the UK. How would they cover all 80 people if they turned up together?! Work surfaces were cluttered up. How could any one work in such cramped and small kitchen?

Any way. My amazement didn't just end there. I had to use the 'restroom' or toilet in English. I stood there and looked for an electric switch because the toilet was dark. Then I thought, may be it will automatically light up on entering. But, no such luck. I started fumbling for the switch on either side of the door. I soon found it and switched on the light. But, the switch itself was rather precariously fixed to the wall as it was rather loose. I locked the door from the bolt provided and I sat down to do my business. Suddenly, the door swung open and hit my knee. Well, that bolt was of no use.

I returned to my table and waited for our order to arrive. Little did we know that they were in the middle of taking a lot of stuff, utensils, the barbeque etc etc. A lot of workers kept on going in and out marching right through the middle of the restaurant for at least 20 minutes. We were just about to cancel our order and leave. Then some one came over and we explained that we had waited long enough.

Well, the whole experience was rather disappointing. But, I must admire the quality of food. It was reasonable to good. But the serving was not what I would expect. I ordered the semolina onion crepe. It was good but in four folds. The little sambhar bowl and three chutneys bowls were placed directly over the 'onion rava dosa' served with a large spoon not fit for the sambhar bowl. 

I had to remove all 4 bowls before I could dive into the crepe, which was quite flattened with weight of the 4 bowls. The next shock was the 'masala' or potato onion sabzi. The potato size was so large that just 2 pieces made up the whole 'masala'! I had to call for knife and fork to cut them into eatable size with the thin crepe. But, the large pieces of potato were rather taseless as the spices hadn't penetrated thoroughly.

We had also ordered 'chana bhatoora' and multilayered pratha. The plain flour dough was not cooked right through. I think they should try 'chapati' flour or use yeast for the 'bhatoora' to make it more palatable. As 'bhatoora' cools it becomes more rubbery.

I'm sure they could get special serving plates with 3 or 4 bowl positions. And, should also improve on cutlery. 

Overall. I'll give 2 out of 5.

data.title: Good Vegetarian Indian Food
data.text:
Navaratna is the only authentic vegetarian Indian restaurant in Stamford.

Pros: They have good selection of both South & North Indian menu and their dishes tastes good.

Cons: Sometimes you need wait longer since the dishes are freshly prepared.

data.title: Dinner and lunch
data.text: Have been there three times.  Have never been disappointed.  Very nice menu, great selection of yummy vegetarian Indian dishes.  It is a vegetarian reataurant.  The service is good.   Never had a bad meal there.

data.title: After beach day dinner in Stamford
data.text: Excellent service, huge menu, good guidance on ordering from the waiter, delicious food. We returned something for being too spicy, they were totally ok with it and took it back no charge. And they even gave my yr old a free mango shake for dessert.

data.title: Um, FANTASTIC
data.text:
So, let's say you want to have a great kosher, south Indian meal, and you are in Stamford, Connecticut. By far, the best Kosher, South Indian restaurant in Stamford is Navratna!!
Seriously, the food is excellent.
Go for the twelve buck Mumbai Thali.

user_location.name: New York, New York, United States

data.title: A Real Gem!
data.text:
One of the best Kosher Restaurants you will ever come across!
Authentic Indian cuisine and it's kosher!
The service was great and the food was delicious.
The most affordable Kosher Dining I have come across 
in North America.
The soups are out of this world.
Highly recommended when visiting Stamford.

data.title: Enjoyable Indian vegetarian delights
data.text: Was in Stamford on business and thought I would give Navaratna a try.  I first looked an Tripadvisor and the restaurant has a very good rating and it was in walking distance from my hotel.  It was most enjoyable.  Was a nice evening so I sat outside.  I ordered lentil meatballs.  Very good and just the right amount of spice.  Service was friendly and attentive.

data.title: Tasty Indian food
data.text: This is one of the best place to have Indian food. Ambiance is nice and overall you get a feel of home country. Cost wise bit expensive but very tasty.

data.title: Awesome
data.text: During my US visit i was missing indian food. Tried this hotel based on recommendation from a friend. although i have not gone to this place just order food online few times. Food was good and reached on time. Its worth to try this as price is ok.

data.title: Great food and service
data.text: I have lived in the CT area for 10 years ago. Early on, a Sunday visit to satisfy the craving for Indian food meant a long trek to Edison, New Jersey, or navigating through heavy New York traffic to Lexington Avenue. With Navaratna now in Stamford, we can enjoy a relaxed lunch or dinner. Great taste, great variety and very authentic. Good selection of north and South Indian. Finally the prices are reasonable!

data.title: Great Indian and Kosher too!
data.text: The food is very tasty and consistently good. The Gobi Malagai (sp?) is one of my favorites. Prices are really reasonable and the atmosphere is lovely.

data.title: Updated review - still great!
data.text: I reviewed this place before (maybe 3 years ago). We still love it. We stop here whenever we can while passing through along the I-95 corridor. It is special in having South Indian dishes as well as the more familiar North Indian fare that most Indian restauarants in the US make, and an assortment of rice dishes beyond biriyani. This place is a gem!

data.title: Good Vegeterian classy food.
data.text: I'm a hard core non-vegeterian, but there are days when I miss my simple humble vegie foods. I have been to this place a multiple times. To the best of my knowledge this happens to be the only place in Stamford where you get chats - Bhelpuri, masalapuri, pav bhaji, samosa masala etc etc. This place doesn't make me miss my country.

data.title: Will go there any time
data.text:
My husband loves meat.  So it took some persuasion to get him to go to Navaratna one evening before the concert.   I have  been there twice: for lunch and dinner.   I love that place.  Great food.  Lovely ambiance.  Friendly staff.  You can say, it is a good Indian Reataurant because of the patrons.  Majority of patrons were From India or surrounding countries. It is always a good sign.  Why I know? My husband is very sociable, he loves talking to people, asking about their favorite dishes etc.   long short story short.... My husband loved it.   It is a vegetarian restaurant.  But what a treat!   I didn't  miss meat at all, and neither did he.    I would though recommend the staff smiling more.  Nobody likes grouchy waiter.  

We will be back

data.title: Best indian Vegetarian food
data.text:
Our favorite restaurant in Stamford.Great service, value for money(In Stamford), wide varieties.

Friendly people and best Bisibellabath from Ramesh. ;-)

data.title: Best Indian Cuisine in Stamford.
data.text:
1. Value for Money.
2. Same great taste every time.
3. Serves Best Manchurian in town.
3.South Indian Dishes are good too.
